cosmetic rhinoplasty. request for cosmetic change in the external appearance of the nose.
anesthesia: general via endotracheal tube.
the patient is a 26-year-old white female with longstanding nasal obstruction.

text: concerns with regard to the external appearance of her nose
context: she also has concerns with regard to the external appearance of her nose and is requesting changes in the external appearance of her nose.
from her functional standpoint, she has severe left-sided nasal septal deviation with compensatory inferior turbinate hypertrophy.
from her functional standpoint, she has severe left-sided nasal septal deviation with compensatory inferior turbinate hypertrophy.
from the aesthetic standpoint, the nose is over projected, lacks rotation, and has a large dorsal hump.

first we are going to straighten the nasal septum and reduce the size of the turbinates and then we will also take down the hump, rotate the tip of the nose, and de-project the nasal tip.

text: reduce the size of the turbinates

procedure began with a left hemitransfixion incision, which was brought down into the left intercartilaginous incision.
right intercartilaginous incision was also made and the dorsum of the nose was elevated in the submucoperichondrial and subperiosteal plane.

text: severe left-sided nasal septal deviation was corrected
context: intact bilateral septomucoperichondrial flaps were elevated and a severe left-sided nasal septal deviation was corrected by detachment of the caudal nasal septum from the maxillary crest in a swinging door fashion and placing it back into the midline.
posterior vomerine spur was divided superiorly and inferiorly and a large spur was removed.
posterior vomerine spur was divided superiorly and inferiorly and a large spur was removed.

text: anterior and inferior one-third of each inferior turbinate was clamped, cut, and resected
context: anterior and inferior one-third of each inferior turbinate was clamped, cut, and resected.

text: upper lateral cartilages were divided from their attachments to the dorsal nasal septum
context: the upper lateral cartilages were divided from their attachments to the dorsal nasal septum and the cartilaginous septum was lowered by approximately 2 mm.

text: cartilaginous septum was lowered by approximately 2 mm
context: the upper lateral cartilages were divided from their attachments to the dorsal nasal septum and the cartilaginous septum was lowered by approximately 2 mm.

text: bony hump of the nose was lowered with a straight osteotome by 4 mm
context: the bony hump of the nose was lowered with a straight osteotome by 4 mm.

text: fading medial osteotomies were carried out
context: fading medial osteotomies were carried out and lateral osteotomies were then created in order to narrow the bony width of the nose.
fading medial osteotomies were carried out and lateral osteotomies were then created in order to narrow the bony width of the nose.

text: tip of the nose was then addressed via a retrograde dissection
context: the tip of the nose was then addressed via a retrograde dissection and removal of cephalic caudal semicircle cartilage medially at the tip.

text: removal of cephalic caudal semicircle cartilage medially at the tip
context: the tip of the nose was then addressed via a retrograde dissection and removal of cephalic caudal semicircle cartilage medially at the tip.

text: caudal septum was shortened by 2 mm in an angle in order to enhance rotation
context: the caudal septum was shortened by 2 mm in an angle in order to enhance rotation.

text: medial crural footplates were reattached to the caudal nasal septum with a projection rotation control suture of #3-0 chromic
context: medial crural footplates were reattached to the caudal nasal septum with a projection rotation control suture of #3-0 chromic.

text: upper lateral cartilages were rejoined to the dorsal septum with a #4-0 plain gut suture
context: the upper lateral cartilages were rejoined to the dorsal septum with a #4-0 plain gut suture.

text: intact mucoperichondrial flaps were closed with 4-0 plain gut suture
context: intact mucoperichondrial flaps were closed with 4-0 plain gut suture and doyle nasal splints were placed on either side of the nasal septum.

text: doyle nasal splints were placed on either side of the nasal septum
context: intact mucoperichondrial flaps were closed with 4-0 plain gut suture and doyle nasal splints were placed on either side of the nasal septum.

text: middle meatus was filled with surgicel and cortisporin otic
context: the middle meatus was filled with surgicel and cortisporin otic and external denver splint was applied with sterile tape and mastisol.

text: external denver splint was applied with sterile tape and mastisol
